intro: Syngonanthus xantholepis, commonly known as the yellow-stemmed grass, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family Poaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in grassland and savanna habitats. The plant is characterized by its slender, yellow-green stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of the Poaceae family. Syngonanthus xantholepis is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local biodiversity.
